name: Jigsaw World
overview: Jigsaw World is a jigsaw puzzle game, and the sequel to Jigsaw Party. Much like its predecessor, it combines the jigsaw puzzle with elements of arcade puzzle games, tasking two players (or a player and the computer) with solving a set of puzzles as quickly as possible. Pieces are supplied to each player in a specific order, and there are also power-ups that can be used to hinder the other player. The main attraction is the Alice in Jigsaw Land story mode, a parody of Lewis Carrol's famous novel, in which the player controls Alice as she competes against a variety of characters in jigsaw puzzle battles. In addition to the battle modes, there is also a regular puzzle mode for one player. There are over 100 puzzles, including both photographs and illustrations, each of which can be played as either a 24, 96, or 150 piece puzzle.
